description.narrative: To improve the living conditions of project-supported rural communities in terms of access to basic social services and sustainable income increase.

condition.narrative: The Borrower has adopted the Project Manuals
The Borrower has recruited the independent auditors
The Borrower may open and maintain three special deposit accounts (Special Accounts A, B and C) in one or more commercial banks
The Borrower shal update the Procurement Plan not later than 12 months after the date of the preceeding Procurement Plan
The Borrower shall establish no later then 12 months after the Effective Date, Local Orientation Committees
The Borrower shall establish no later then 12 months after the Effective Date, Regional Steering Committees
The Borrower shall establish no later then 12 months after the Effective Date, four RPIUs
The Borrower shall undertake not later than 36 months after the Effective Date a midterm review
The Project Agreement has been duly authorized or ratified by ANICT
The Subsidiary Agreement has been duly authorized or ratified by the Borrower and ANICT
the Borrower has contracted an ODC for each of the regions where the Project will be implemented
the Borrower has established and maintained te National Steering Committee
the Borrower has established the PIU with the key personnel
the Borrower has put in place a computerized financial management system and a monitoring and evaluation system for the Project
the Subsidiary Agreement has been executed on behalf of the Borrower and ANICT

title.narrative: Percentage of villages with adequate access to basic social services

comment.narrative: School within 5km; Clinic within 15km; Water access for 400 people.

title.narrative: Number of annual multi-stakeholder steering committees
Number of private service and training providers trained by the project.
By the end of the project, at least 50% of community-based organizations have implemented improved natural resources management practices
Percentage of beneficiary social associations properly functioning
Percentage of productive projects that have generated average annual income per member superior to the daily poverty line.
Percentage of community based organizations that have benefited from at least one social or productive subprojets with still functionning management commitees.
Percentage of beneficiary producer organizations that are still properly functioning and making profits
Percentage of social investment with increased attendance rate
Number of activity reports validated by the steeering committees
